title: Infer the secreted protein activity from gene expression in bulk level
text: current case includes differential expression profiles anti-IFNG treatment control samples.
code: library(SecAct)  # prepare expression matrix exprPath <- file.path(system.file(package="SecAct"), "extdata/IFNG_GSE100093.diff.gz") expr <- read.csv(exprPath, row.names=1, check.names=F)  # run SecAct to infer activity; ~3 mins res <- SecAct.inference(expr)  # show activity head(res$zscore)  ##         Anti-IFNG.15day Anti-IFNG.57day ## A1BG        27.41700606       15.560484 ## A2M         -1.00132544        3.703776 ## A2ML1       -5.70139021       -5.585635 ## AADACL2     -0.03412573        8.556714 ## ABHD15       7.91357240        3.360326 ## ABI3BP      -1.57170759       -4.292832  # show IFNG activity res$zscore["IFNG",]  ## Anti-IFNG.15day Anti-IFNG.57day  ##       -10.76148       -30.50151

title: Infer the secreted protein activity from gene expression in bulk level
text: case aims infer secreted protein activity pancreatic cancer RNA-Seq cohorts CPTAC. Note: control samples, recommend normalize expression values gene zero mean across samples. words, just use expression matrix control.
code: library(SecAct)  # read expression matrix exprPath <- file.path(system.file(package="SecAct"), "extdata/CPTAC_PDAC_Tumor.csv.gz") expr <- read.csv(exprPath, row.names=1, check.names=F)  exprControlPath <- file.path(system.file(package="SecAct"), "extdata/CPTAC_PDAC_Normal.csv.gz") exprControl <- read.csv(exprControlPath, row.names=1, check.names=F)  # normalize expression matrix expr <- expr - rowMeans(exprControl)  # run SecAct to infer activity res <- SecAct.inference(expr, lambda=10000, nrand=1000)  # show activity head(res$zscore) # normalize the expression values of each gene to zero mean across samples expr <- expr - rowMeans(expr)

title: Clinical relavance of secreted proteins in a large patient cohort
text: section shows read expression matrix R environment.
code: library(SecAct)  # prepare expression matrix dataPath <- file.path(system.file(package="SecAct"), "extdata/") expr <- read.table(paste0(dataPath,"Pancreatic_Nivolumab_Padron2022.logTPM.gz"), check.names=F)

title: Clinical relavance of secreted proteins in a large patient cohort
text: use SecAct.activity.inference infer activity >1000 secreted proteins across samples. data control samples (e.g., normal patients), can assign inputProfile_control. available, just set inputProfile_control=NULL (default). SecAct normalize expression values gene zero mean across input profiles. words, mean gene expression input profiles regarded control.

title: Clinical relavance of secreted proteins in a large patient cohort
text: next calculate risk score secreted protein integrating activity levels clinical data. clinical file, please make sure name 1st 2nd columns “Time” “Event”, respectively.
code: # read clinical infomation clinical <- read.table(paste0(dataPath,"Pancreatic_Nivolumab_Padron2022.OS_Nivo+Sotiga+Chemo"))  head(clinical)  ##    Time Event Age Gender ECOG ## 8   834     0  55      1    0 ## 13   28     1  60      0    1 ## 15  273     1  69      0    0 ## 22  159     1  69      0    1 ## 24  569     0  62      0    0 ## 25  264     1  66      1    1  # compute risk score riskMat <- SecAct.coxph(act, clinical)  head(riskMat)  ##            risk z     p value ## A1BG    -2.187803 0.028683943 ## A2M     -3.372297 0.000745439 ## A2ML1    1.668025 0.095310824 ## AADACL2 -1.960305 0.049960191 ## ABHD15  -2.511890 0.012008638 ## ABI3BP  -1.679394 0.093075338

title: Clinical relavance of secreted proteins in a large patient cohort
text: User can visualize secreted proteins interest. , select top high low risk secreted proteins examples.  positive value means secreted protein associated unfavorable (pro-tumor) outcome negative value means secreted protein associated favorable (anti-tumor) outcome.
code: # select top 10 secreted proteins (SPs) high.SPs <- names(sort(riskMat[,"risk z"],decreasing=T))[1:10] low.SPs <- names(sort(riskMat[,"risk z"]))[1:10]  SPs <- c(high.SPs, low.SPs) # user can assign any secreted proteins to SPs  # generate a vector fg.vec <- riskMat[SPs,"risk z"]  # visualize in lollipop plot SecAct.lollipop.plot(fg.vec, title="Risk score z")

title: Clinical relavance of secreted proteins in a large patient cohort
text: User can select secreted protein interest draw survival plot using SecAct.survival.plot.  activity cutoff selected maximizing difference high low patient groups.
code: # Take WNT7B as an example riskMat["WNT7B",]  ##       risk z      p value  ## 3.3252642698 0.0008833476   # visualize in bar plot SecAct.survival.plot(act, clinical, "WNT7B", x.title="Overall (Days)")

title: Secreted protein activity difference between two phenotypes
text: section demonstrates read expression matrix
code: library(SecAct)  # prepare expression matrix dataPath <- file.path(system.file(package="SecAct"), "extdata/") expr <- read.csv(paste0(dataPath,"GSE100093.IFNG.expr.gz"), sep="\t")  # read meta infomation meta <- read.csv(paste0(dataPath,"GSE100093.IFNG.meta"), sep="\t")  # subset treatment and control group expr.treatment <- expr[,meta[,"Treatment"]=="Anti-IFNG"] expr.control <- expr[,meta[,"Treatment"]=="Control"]

title: Secreted protein activity difference between two phenotypes
text: input expr.treatment expr.control SecAct.activity.inference infer activity difference >1000 secreted proteins treatment control groups. Setting .singleSampleLevel = FALSE leads SecAct calculate overall activity change two phenotypes. can also obtain activity change sample expr.treatment .singleSampleLevel = TRUE. can see IFNG activity decreased treatment group received anti-IFNG therapy.
code: # infer activity difference; ~2 mins res <- SecAct.activity.inference(   inputProfile = expr.treatment,    inputProfile_control = expr.control,   is.singleSampleLevel = FALSE )  # res$zscore stores activity difference act.diff <- res$zscore  # show activity difference head(act.diff)  ##              Diff ## A1BG    12.412416 ## A2M      1.654828 ## A2ML1   -7.130571 ## AADACL2  8.538400 ## ABHD15   1.720629 ## ABI3BP  -8.170191  # show IFNG activity difference act.diff["IFNG","Diff"]  ## [1] -35.67649

title: Secreted protein activity difference between two phenotypes
text: User can visualize secreted proteins interest. , select top - -regulated secreted proteins treatment control examples.  positive value means secreted protein high activity treatment group negative value means secreted protein high activity control group.
code: # select top 10 secreted proteins (SPs) up.SPs <- names(sort(act.diff[,"Diff"],decreasing=T))[1:10] down.SPs <- names(sort(act.diff[,"Diff"]))[1:10]  SPs <- c(up.SPs, down.SPs) # user can assign any secreted proteins to SPs  # generate a vector fg.vec <- act.diff[SPs,"Diff"]  # visualize in bar plot SecAct.bar.plot(fg.vec, title="Activity Diff (treatment vs control)")

title: Secreted protein activity difference between two phenotypes
text: already differential profile (signature) instead expression matrix two phenotypes, can directly run SecAct.activity.inference .differential = TRUE.
code: # compare two phenotypes to get differential profile expr.diff <- rowMeans(expr.treatment) - rowMeans(expr.control)  # generate input matrix expr.diff <- as.matrix(expr.diff, ncol=1) colnames(expr.diff) <- "Diff"   # Run against to differential profile res <- SecAct.activity.inference(   inputProfile = expr.diff,    is.differential = TRUE )  # res$zscore stores activity difference act.diff <- res$zscore  # show activity difference head(act.diff)

title: Cell-cell communication mediated by secreted proteins from scRNA-Seq data
text: preprocessed OV scRNA-Seq dataset saved Seurat object. information cell-type annotations anatomical sites stored columns MyCellType Groups meta.data Seurat object, respectively. Users can easily access using following code.
code: library(SecAct) library(Seurat)  # load scRNA-Seq data dataPath <- file.path(system.file(package="SecAct"), "extdata/") Seurat_obj <- readRDS(paste0(dataPath,"OV_scRNAseq.rds"))  # cell count table(Seurat_obj@meta.data[,"Groups"])  ## Metastatic    Primary  ##      18746      17589   # show UMAP plot my_cols <- c(     'B'='#C88888','CD4T'='#3288bd','CD8T'='#B95FBB','DC'='#63636d',     'Endothelial'='#D4D915','Fibroblast'='#66c2a5','Macrophage'='#ff9a36',     'NK'='#bb8761','Tex'='#fe666d','Treg'='#E6C122','Tumor'='#A4DFF2' )  p1 <- DimPlot(Seurat_obj, reduction = "umap", cols = my_cols, group.by = "MyCellType") p2 <- DimPlot(Seurat_obj, reduction = "umap", group.by = "Groups")  p1+p2

title: Cell-cell communication mediated by secreted proteins from scRNA-Seq data
text: strategy performs three steps infer condition-specific cell-cell communication: (1) calculating changes secreted protein activity cell type two conditions, (2) assessing changes secreted protein expression cell type two conditions, (3) linking sender receiver cell types. running SecAct.CCC.scRNAseq, user need claim column Seurat_obj@meta.data stores cell-type annotations, also claim column stores condition information case control conditions. SecAct results stored Seurat_obj @misc $SecAct_output.
code: # infer cell-cell communication Seurat_obj <- SecAct.CCC.scRNAseq(   Seurat_obj,    cellType_meta="MyCellType",   condition_meta="Groups",    conditionCase="Metastatic",    conditionControl="Primary",   act_diff_cutoff=1.5,   exp_logFC_cutoff=0.5,   exp_fraction_case_cutoff=0.4,   padj_cutoff=0.01 )  # show output names(Seurat_obj @misc $SecAct_output)  ## [1] "SecretedProteinActivity" ## [2] "SecretedProteinExpression" ## [3] "SecretedProteinCCC"  # cell-cell communication results head(Seurat_obj @misc $SecAct_output $SecretedProteinCCC)

title: Cell-cell communication mediated by secreted proteins from scRNA-Seq data
text: provide two types visualization plot cell-cell communication, .e., heatmap circle plot.  User can select cell-cell communication Seurat_obj @misc $SecAct_output $SecretedProteinCCC visualize .
code: SecAct.CCC.heatmap(Seurat_obj, row.sorted=TRUE, column.sorted=TRUE, colors_cellType=my_cols) SecAct.CCC.circle(Seurat_obj, colors_cellType=my_cols) sender <- c("Fibroblast","Macrophage","Endothelial","CD8T","Tex") receiver <- c("Tumor") secretedProtein <- c("COL18A1","CST3","FN1","HSPG2","SERPING1","COL15A1", "TGFB1","HSPG2","ISG15","COL18A1","TIMP1","BGN", "FAP","THBS2","SPARC","COL1A1","COL1A2","TGFBI", "VCAN","POSTN","FBN1","MXRA5","HTRA1","BMP1","FSTL1")  SecAct.CCC.sankey(   Seurat_obj,    my_cols,    sender=sender,    secretedProtein=secretedProtein,    receiver=receiver )

title: Secreted protein signaling activity for various cell states from scRNA-Seq data
text: scRNA-Seq data CD4+ T cells stored Seurat object. Three cell states identified, .e., naive, central memory, T helper 1-like.
code: library(SecAct) library(Seurat)  # load scRNA-Seq data dataPath <- file.path(system.file(package="SecAct"), "extdata/") Seurat_obj <- readRDS(paste0(dataPath,"OV_scRNAseq_CD4.rds"))  # cell count table(Seurat_obj@meta.data[,"Annotation"])  ## CD4_central_memory          CD4_naive       CD4_Th1_like  ##                402                 28                358   # show UMAP plot Seurat::DimPlot(Seurat_obj, reduction = "umap", group.by = "Annotation")

title: Secreted protein signaling activity for various cell states from scRNA-Seq data
text: loading single-cell data, user can input Seurat_obj SecAct.activity.inference infer activities 1248 secreted proteins various cell types. Also, need claim column meta matrix Seurat object cell type information. case, just assign cellType_meta="Annotation". User can find SecAct results Seurat_obj@misc$SecretedProteinActivity.
code: # infer activity Seurat_obj <- SecAct.activity.inference.scRNAseq(Seurat_obj, cellType_meta="Annotation")  # SecretedProteinActivity$zscore stores activity act <- Seurat_obj @misc $SecAct_output $SecretedProteinActivity$zscore  # show activity head(act)  ##         CD4_central_memory  CD4_naive CD4_Th1_like ## A1BG            -0.5224152 -2.5877798   5.04170281 ## A2M             -1.8165372  1.0789818  -0.08903819 ## A2ML1            4.6669228 -3.4408384   1.41266953 ## AADACL2          2.2806474 -3.1300577   3.23410538 ## ABHD15           0.2801044  0.1688928  -0.55981830 ## ABI3BP          -0.7084864  1.5764300  -2.08041961

title: Secreted protein signaling activity for various cell states from scRNA-Seq data
text: User can visualize secreted proteins interest. , select top activating secreted proteins cell states.
code: # select top 10 secreted proteins (SPs) n <- 10 SPs.1 <- names(sort(act[,1],decreasing=T))[1:n] SPs.2 <- names(sort(act[,2],decreasing=T))[1:n] SPs.3 <- names(sort(act[,3],decreasing=T))[1:n]  SPs <- c(SPs.1, SPs.2, SPs.3) # user can assign any secreted proteins to SPs  # subset act matrix fg.mat <- act[SPs,]  # visualize in heatmap SecAct.heatmap.plot(fg.mat)

title: Infer the secreted protein activity from single-cell RNA-Seq data
text: , use scRNA-Seq data includes T cell Normal Tumor tissue.
code: library(SecAct)  # load seurat object seuratPath <- file.path(system.file(package="SecAct"), "extdata/OV_GSE156728.rds") seurat_obj <- readRDS(seuratPath)  # extract count matrix expr <-  as.matrix(seurat_obj@assays$RNA@layers$counts) colnames(expr) <- rownames(seurat_obj@assays$RNA@cells) rownames(expr) <- rownames(seurat_obj@assays$RNA@features)  # normalize to TPM expr <- t(t(expr)*1e6/colSums(expr))  # transform to log space expr <- log2(expr/10 + 1)  # normalized with the control samples expr <- expr - rowMeans(expr) expr <- round(expr,3)  # run SecAct to infer activity res_sc <- SecAct.inference(expr) Sys.time() # show activity head(res$zscore)

title: Infer the secreted protein activity from single-cell RNA-Seq data
text: can integrate activity results Seurat object, visiualize .
code: res_sc_z <- t(res_sc$zscore) colnames(res_sc_z) <- paste0("activity_",colnames(res_sc_z))  seurat_obj@meta.data <- cbind(seurat_obj@meta.data,res_sc_z)  library(Seurat) library(ggplot2) library(patchwork)  p1 <- FeaturePlot(seurat_obj, reduction = "umap", features = c("activity_IFNG")) +   scale_colour_gradient2(low = "blue", mid = "white", high = "red") p2 <- DimPlot(seurat_obj, reduction = "umap", group.by = "cellType") p3 <- VlnPlot(seurat_obj, features = c("activity_IFNG"), )  p1|p2|p3

what: Read ST data to an SpaCET object
title: Infer secreted protein activity in spatial transcriptomics data
text: dataset includes two endometrial cancer patients treated anti-Netrin-1 (NTN1) compound. Netrin-1 secreted glycoprotein plays critical roles angiogenesis cell survival, blocking NTN1 inhibits tumor growth. patient pre- -treatment tumor samples, respectively. read ST data R, user can create SpaCET object using create.SpaCET.object.10X.
code: library(SpaCET)  # set the path to the data folder. dataPath <- file.path(system.file(package="SecAct"), "extdata/")  # load ST data to create an SpaCET object. # read on-treatment sample visiumPath <- paste0(dataPath,"UCEC_On/") SpaCET_obj_on <- create.SpaCET.object.10X(visiumPath = visiumPath) SpaCET_obj_on <- SpaCET.quality.control(SpaCET_obj_on)  # read pre-treatment sample visiumPath <- paste0(dataPath,"UCEC_Pre/") SpaCET_obj_pre <- create.SpaCET.object.10X(visiumPath = visiumPath) SpaCET_obj_pre <- SpaCET.quality.control(SpaCET_obj_pre)

title: Infer secreted protein activity in spatial transcriptomics data
text: loading ST data, user can run SecAct.inference infer activities 1000 secreted proteins across spot. note, analyze -treatment sample, pre-treatment sample set control. , normalize expression values gene -treatment sample -spot mean pre-treatment sample. analyzing pre-treatment sample, control sample unavailable. Just normalize expression values gene pre-treatment sample zero mean across spots. words, just regard ST sample control sample.
code: # extract count matrix expr_on <- as.matrix(SpaCET_obj_on@input$counts) expr_pre <- as.matrix(SpaCET_obj_pre@input$counts)  # normalize to TPM expr_on <- t(t(expr_on)*1e6/colSums(expr_on)) expr_pre <- t(t(expr_pre)*1e6/colSums(expr_pre))  # transform to log space expr_on <- log2(expr_on/10 + 1) expr_pre <- log2(expr_pre/10 + 1)  # normalized with the control samples expr_on_rmControl <- expr_on - rowMeans(expr_pre) expr_on_rmControl <- round(expr_on_rmControl,3)  expr_pre_rmControl <- expr_pre - rowMeans(expr_pre) expr_pre_rmControl <- round(expr_pre_rmControl,3)  # run SecAct to infer activity library(SecAct) res_on <- SecAct.inference(expr_on_rmControl) res_pre <- SecAct.inference(expr_pre_rmControl)

title: Infer secreted protein activity in spatial transcriptomics data
text: can integrate activity results SpaCET object, visiualize .
code: SpaCET_obj_on@results$activity <- res_on SpaCET_obj_pre@results$activity <- res_pre  library(patchwork) p1 <- SecAct.spatial.velocity(SpaCET_obj_pre, gene = "TGFB1", signalMode="receiving")  p2 <- SecAct.spatial.velocity(SpaCET_obj_on, gene = "TGFB1", signalMode="receiving")   p1|p2

what: Read ST data to a SpaCET object
title: Cell-cell communication for single-cell resolution spatial transcriptomics data
text: load data R, user can create SpaCET object preparing two types input data. spatial transcriptomics count data. spatial transcriptomics count data must format matrix gene name (row) x spot ID (column). spatial location information. spot coordinates format matrix spot ID (row) x coordinates (column). 1st 2nd columns represent X Y coordinates, respectively.
code: library(SecAct) library(SpaCET)  dataPath <- file.path(system.file(package="SecAct"), "extdata/") load(paste0(dataPath,"/LIHC_CosMx_toy.rda"))  # show count matrix dim(counts) ## [1]  1000 50888  # show coordinate matrix spotCoordinates[1:5,]  ##              x_slide_mm y_slide_mm       cellType ## c_2_323_101     6.60536    3.32788     Tumor_core ## c_2_324_367     6.83920    3.10276 Tumor_boundary ## c_2_324_628     6.92860    3.43312     Tumor_core ## c_2_324_924     6.82864    3.21076     Tumor_core ## c_2_325_1167    7.57440    3.14704     Tumor_core  # load ST data to create an SpaCET object SpaCET_obj <- create.SpaCET.object(   counts=counts,   spotCoordinates=spotCoordinates,   metaData=metaData,   imagePath=NA,   platform = "CosMx" )  # show this object. str(SpaCET_obj)   # show the spatial distribution of all cell types my_cols <- c(     'B'='#C88888','Erythrocyte'='#fe666d','T.alpha.beta'='#B95FBB','T.gamma.delta'='#3288bd',     'NK'='#bb8761','Hepatocyte'='#63636d','Cholangiocyte'='#de77ae','Endothelial'='#D4D915',     'Fibroblast'='#66c2a5','Macrophage'='#ff9a36','Tumor_core'='#A4DFF2','Tumor_interface'='blue' )  SpaCET.visualize.spatialFeature(   SpaCET_obj,    spatialType = "metaData",    spatialFeatures= "cellType",   colors = my_cols,   pointSize = 0.6 ) # filter out cells with less than 50 expressed genes SpaCET_obj <- SpaCET.quality.control(SpaCET_obj, min.genes=50)  # plot the QC metrics SpaCET.visualize.spatialFeature(   SpaCET_obj,    spatialType = "QualityControl",    spatialFeatures=c("UMI","Gene"),   imageBg = TRUE )

title: Cell-cell communication for single-cell resolution spatial transcriptomics data
text: strategy performs three steps infer condition-specific cell-cell communication: (1) calculating changes secreted protein activity cell type two conditions, (2) assessing changes secreted protein expression cell type two conditions, (3) linking sender receiver cell types. running SecAct.CCC.ST, user need claim column Seurat_obj@meta.data stores cell-type annotations. Also, claim column stores condition information case control conditions. SecAct results stored Seurat_obj @misc $SecAct_output.
code: # infer activity SpaCET_obj <- SecAct.CCC.scST(     SpaCET_obj,     cellType_meta = "cellType",     scale.factor = 1000,     radius = 0.02,     ratio_cutoff = 0.2,     padj_cutoff = 0.01 )  # show output names(SpaCET_obj @results $SecAct_output)

what: Read ST data to a SpaCET object
title: Signaling patterns and velocities for multi-cellular spatial transcriptomics data
text: load data R, user can create SpaCET object using create.SpaCET.object.10X. Please make sure visiumPath points standard output folders 10x Space Ranger. ST data 10x/Visium, can use create.SpaCET.object instead. Click details.
code: library(SecAct) library(SpaCET)  # set the path to the data folder dataPath <- file.path(system.file(package="SecAct"), "extdata/")  # load ST data to create an SpaCET object visiumPath <- paste0(dataPath,"Visium_HCC_1L/") SpaCET_obj <- create.SpaCET.object.10X(visiumPath = visiumPath)  # filter out spots with less than 1000 expressed genes SpaCET_obj <- SpaCET.quality.control(SpaCET_obj, min.genes = 1000)  # plot the QC metrics SpaCET.visualize.spatialFeature(   SpaCET_obj,    spatialType = "QualityControl",    spatialFeatures = c("UMI","Gene"),   imageBg = TRUE )

title: Signaling patterns and velocities for multi-cellular spatial transcriptomics data
text: loading ST data, user can run SecAct.activity.inference infer activities 1248 secreted proteins spot.

title: Signaling patterns and velocities for multi-cellular spatial transcriptomics data
text: obtaining secreted protein activity, SecAct estimate consensus pattern inferred signaling activities across whole tissue slide. stage contains two steps. First, SecAct filtered 1248 secreted proteins identify secreted proteins mediating intercellular communication. achieve , SecAct calculate linear correlation spots’ RNA expression spots’ neighbors’ signaling activity. cutoffs r > 0.1 FDR < 0.01. Second, SecAct employs non-negative matrix factorization (NMF) estimate consensus patterns. critical parameter NMF factorization rank k. User can assign number vector k, e.g., k=2:5. , SecAct.signaling.pattern find optimal number factors determined point preceding largest decrease silhouette value. take . Based pre-calculation, k=3 optimal number factors. save time, directly run k=3.  want identify secreted proteins specific signaling pattern, please run following code.
code: # estimate signaling pattern SpaCET_obj <- SecAct.signaling.pattern(SpaCET_obj, k=3)  # plot signaling pattern SpaCET.visualize.spatialFeature(     SpaCET_obj,      spatialType = "SignalingPattern",      spatialFeatures = "All",      imageBg = FALSE,     legend.position = "right" ) writeLines(rownames(WWW_n), "/Users/rub2/Downloads/inter_SP.csv")

title: Signaling patterns and velocities for multi-cellular spatial transcriptomics data
text: Several secreted proteins pattern 3 related epithelial-mesenchymal transition process, COL1A1, IL6, TGFB1, SPARC. integrating secreted protein-coding gene expression signaling activity, SecAct can also infer signaling velocity spatial spot, indicating direction strength secreted signaling.Let’s take SPARC example.
code: # show signaling velocity of SPARC SecAct.signaling.velocity.spotST(SpaCET_obj, gene = "SPARC", signalMode="receiving") # show animated signaling velocity of SPARC SecAct.spatial.velocity(SpaCET_obj, gene = "SPARC", signalMode="receiving", animated=TRUE)

title: Signaling patterns and velocities for multi-cellular spatial transcriptomics data
text: current ST data, user also can run previous R package SpaCET estimate cell lineages spot. Click details.  Based deconvolution results, can see interface region consists fibroblasts, macrophages, endothelial cells.
code: # deconvolve ST data SpaCET_obj <- SpaCET.deconvolution(   SpaCET_obj,    cancerType = "LIHC",    coreNo = 8 )  # show the spatial distribution of all cell types. SpaCET.visualize.spatialFeature(   SpaCET_obj,    spatialType = "CellFraction",    spatialFeatures = c(     "Malignant","CAF","Endothelial","Macrophage",     "Hepatocyte","B cell","T CD4","T CD8"),    sameScaleForFraction = TRUE,   pointSize = 0.1,    nrow = 2 )

title: Authors and Citation
text: Beibei Ru. Author, maintainer. Peng Jiang. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Ru B, Jiang P (2025). SecAct: Secreted Signaling Activity Inference. R package version 1.0.0, https://github.com/data2intelligence/SecAct.
code: @Manual{,   title = {SecAct: Secreted Signaling Activity Inference},   author = {Beibei Ru and Peng Jiang},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 1.0.0},   url = {https://github.com/data2intelligence/SecAct}, }

title: Secreted Signaling Activity Inference
text: SecAct R package desighed inferring intercellular activity secreted proteins tumors gene expression profiles. Users can input multiple modalities expression data, including bulk, single-cell, spatial transcriptomics (ST). outputs inferred activities 1248 secreted proteins ST spot, individual cell, sample. Based inferred activities, SecAct provides multiple downstream application modules. spatial data, SecAct can infer signaling pattern signaling velocity secreted proteins. velocity represents signaling direction strength across whole tissue slide. single-cell data, SecAct can infer intercellular communication network signaling flow source cells receiver cells. bulk data, SecAct can infer secreted protein risk scores large cohort linked clinical data, can infer secreted protein activities differentially regulated two phenotypes.

title: Secreted Signaling Activity Inference
text: install SecAct, recommend using devtools: user can install SecAct source code. Click download .
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("data2intelligence/SecAct") # install SecAct in the R environment. install.packages("Path_to_the_source_code", repos = NULL, type="source")

title: Secreted protein activity inference — SecAct.activity.inference
text: inputProfile Gene expression matrix gene symbol (row) x sample (column). .differential logical indicating whether inputProfile differential profiles control. inputProfile_control Gene expression matrix gene symbol (row) x sample (column). .paired logical indicating whether want paired operation differential profiles inputProfile inputProfile_control samples inputProfile inputProfile_control paired. .singleSampleLevel logical indicating whether calculate activity change single sample inputProfile inputProfile_control. FALSE, calculate overall activity change two phenotypes. sigMatrix Secreted protein signature matrix. lambda Penalty factor ridge regression. nrand Number randomization permutation test, default value 1000. sigFilter logical indicating whether filter secreted protein signatures genes inputProfile.
